DOC.brief_summary: This randomize clinical trial study cognitive enhancement program improve cognitive function breast cancer survivor . A cognitive enhancement program may help improve cognitive function breast cancer survivor may help doctor plan good treatment cognitive decline .
DOC.brief_title: Cognitive Enhancement Program Improving Cognitive Function Breast Cancer Survivors
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . To improve cognition woman breast cancer exhibit cognitive decline cognitive enhancement program . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM I ( Cognitive Enhancement Program ) : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM IA ( Lumosity ) : Participants complete Lumosity cognitive exercise . Lumosity cognitive exercise online video game-based activity design practice various cognitive skill include process speed , attention , memory executive function . Participants complete cognitive exercise least 20 minute day , 5 day week 6 week . Participants also complete relaxation exercise ( guided imagery , progressive muscle relaxation , and/or autogenics ) least 10 minute day 6 week compensatory strategy ( use external device notebook , day planner , smartphone cuing , remind , organize ; use memory strategy repetition , paraphrasing , active listening ; use executive strategy self-talk plan attention orientation ) much possible . ARM IB ( Active Journaling ) : Participants complete Active Journal cognitive exercise . Active Journaling require participant keep write diary journal discus thought feeling various event focus describe meaning activity experience , particularly new thing learn . Active Journaling method practice various cognitive skill include communication , organization , memory executive function . Participants complete cognitive exercise least 20 minute day , 5 day week 6 week . Participants also complete relaxation exercise compensatory strategy Arm IA . ARM II ( Lumosity ) : Participants complete Lumosity cognitive exercise Arm IA .
DOC.criteria: Previous diagnosis breast cancer Received chemotherapy treatment breast cancer diagnosis Chemotherapyfree least one year History learning disability , head trauma , neurologic disorder significant psychiatric condition Significant medical condition ( e.g . diabetes ) unrelated cancer diagnosis Magnetic resonance imaging ( MRI ) contraindication ( e.g . metallic biomedical implant ) Pregnancy
